configuration.name: tcpPort
configuration.description: ACC clients will use this port to establish a connection to the server

configuration.name: udpPort
configuration.description: Connected clients will use this Port to stream the car positions and is used for the ping test. In case you never see your server getting a ping value, this indicates that the udpPort is not accessible

configuration.name: registerToLobby
configuration.description: When 0, this server won’t register to the backend. Is useful for LAN sessions. If 0, the server is declared “Private Multiplayer”.

configuration.name: maxConnections
configuration.description: Replaces “maxClients”. The maximum amount of connections a server will accept at a time. If you own the hardware server, you can just set any high number you want. If you rented a 16 or 24 slot server, your Hosting Provider probably has set this here and doesn’t give you write-access to this configuration file

configuration.name: lanDiscovery
configuration.description: Defines if the server will listen to LAN discovery requests. Can be turned off for dedicated servers.
